comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.14) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/3.6.14
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.14) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/3.6.14

When browsing a document with mime Type "text/plain", the text on the screen may continue way to the right. (far-far to the right)

When browsing such a page using keyboard, it is expected that the "End" key would move the cursor to the end of the current LINE. Instead, the "End" key jumps to the end of the entire document.  

In other words, the "End" key behaves exactly like "Ctrl-End". 

I have searched the FireFox forums and other 'zillas... but find no mention of this. (I did find some talk of Ctrl-End doing something with tabbing - but that is not the issue here.)

Would this be considered a bug... or is there some way to specify the keyboard mapping behavior while browsing MimeType of "text/plain" using some config setting? (Is there a workaround?)

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open a file of MimeType "text/plain" which has text lines which go way to the right.
2.Using only the keyboard to navigate, try to jump to the end of a specific LINE using "End" key.
3. whoops, it went to the end of the document as if you hit "Ctrl-End".
comments.creator: bruce.peebs@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.14) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/3.6.14
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.14) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/3.6.14

When browsing a document with mime Type "text/plain", the text on the screen may continue way to the right. (far-far to the right)

When browsing such a page using keyboard, it is expected that the "End" key would move the cursor to the end of the current LINE. Instead, the "End" key jumps to the end of the entire document.  

In other words, the "End" key behaves exactly like "Ctrl-End". 

I have searched the FireFox forums and other 'zillas... but find no mention of this. (I did find some talk of Ctrl-End doing something with tabbing - but that is not the issue here.)

Would this be considered a bug... or is there some way to specify the keyboard mapping behavior while browsing MimeType of "text/plain" using some config setting? (Is there a workaround?)

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open a file of MimeType "text/plain" which has text lines which go way to the right.
2.Using only the keyboard to navigate, try to jump to the end of a specific LINE using "End" key.
3. whoops, it went to the end of the document as if you hit "Ctrl-End".
comments.author: bruce.peebs@gmail.com

comments.text: Oh - I forgot to mention that "Shift-End" knows how to highlight to the end of the current line just fine... it seems to be only the "End" key which misbehaves.
comments.author: bruce.peebs@gmail.com
comments.creator: bruce.peebs@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Oh - I forgot to mention that "Shift-End" knows how to highlight to the end of the current line just fine... it seems to be only the "End" key which misbehaves.

comments.creator: bruce.peebs@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Sorry, I cannot provide an example because the webserver with the files I am seeing are within a secure, firewalled area behind a DMZ. (De Militarized Zone)

However, anyone with a webserver on the internet should be able to serve up a large text file with a mime Type "text/plain".

The bottom line is that keyboard navigation of this kind of file is not fun due to the "End" key misbehaving.
comments.text:
Sorry, I cannot provide an example because the webserver with the files I am seeing are within a secure, firewalled area behind a DMZ. (De Militarized Zone)

However, anyone with a webserver on the internet should be able to serve up a large text file with a mime Type "text/plain".

The bottom line is that keyboard navigation of this kind of file is not fun due to the "End" key misbehaving.
comments.author: bruce.peebs@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
I just thought of a way you can view a "text/plain" file.  Simply use FireFox to open a local file on your harddrive.  As long as the file suffix is ".txt" or ".log", it should open with mime Type "text/plain". (you can always verify by right-clicking and select "View Page Info" to see the "Type")

Here is an example:  file:///C:/Program%20Files/Mozilla%20Firefox/install.log
comments.author: bruce.peebs@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
I do see the issue when using the install.log.

Did this used to work? Do you know when it broke?

Also occurs in Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110618 Firefox/7.0a1 ID:20110618030732

comments.raw_text:
I am involved in characterizing the performance of "Firefox ESR" edition.

During my testing, I noted that the issue brought forth in this bugzilla is *still* a problem.
